message.msgstr: Enable Virtual Private Network support.
This indicator shows current state of VPN connection.
Specify user name given by your network provider.
Specify password given by your network provider.
Select VPN authentication protocol type.
Select available interface for PPPoE.
Some internet providers need to set up special PPPoE service name. You can specify it here.
Specify Access Concentrator name for PPPoE connection. If no Access Concentrator name is set system will try to connect to first available Access Concentrator.
Specify host address (IP address or domain name) of VPN server.
Use the following IP as VPN server own IP address in your VPN network.
Specify Access Point Name given by network provider. If no Access Point Name is specified it will be taken from modem default settings.
Specify range of IP addresses given to clients by VPN server in L2TP server mode.
Specify Maximum Transfer Unit/Maximum Recieve Unit size in octets.
Enable automatic Microsoft Point-to-Point Encryption (MPPE) mode. Need set authentication method to mschap.
Manage default gateway replacing in routing table.
Disabled means that no default gateway will be written to routing table.
Enabled means that default gateway will be replaced by gateway given by network provider.
Multiple means that default gateway will be added to existing gateway but with metric 10.
Allow to get DNS adress from VPN server and write to /etv/ppp/resolv.conf.
Check that VPN server is reachable before initiation of VPN connection.
Allow debug mode for VPN connections.
Add Network Address Translation to new VPN connection.
Enable adaptive LCP echo interval.
Enable PURE mode if you ISP use PPPoE without DHCP (Rostelecom/R-Telecom and others ISP).

If this option is given, pppd will presume the peer to be dead if n LCP echo-requests are sent without receiving a valid LCP echo-reply. If this happens, pppd will terminate the connection. Use of this option requires a non-zero value for the LCP echo interval parameter. This option can be used to enable pppd to terminate after the physical connection has been broken (e.g., the modem has hung up) in situations where no hardware modem control lines are available.

If this option is given, pppd will send an LCP echo-request frame to the peer every specified value of seconds. Normally the peer should respond to the echo-request by sending an echo-reply. This option can be used with the LCP echo failure option to detect that the peer is no longer connected.
Specify VPN access mode.

PPPoE (see RFC #2516) means encapsulating Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) frames inside Ethernet frames. It is used mainly with DSL services where individual users connect to the DSL modem over Ethernet and in plain Metro Ethernet networks.
PPTP (see RFC #2637) means a method for implementing virtual private networks. PPTP uses a control channel over TCP and a GRE tunnel operating to encapsulate PPP packets.

L2TP (see RFC #2661) means a tunneling protocol used to support virtual private networks. It does not provide any encryption or confidentiality by itself; it relies on an encryption protocol that it passes within the tunnel to provide privacy.
L2TP client means a connection to remote L2TP server.
L2TP server means a connection from remote machines to L2TP server on this router.
Modem GPRS means connection to Internet via GPRS/EDGE in GSM mobile networks.
Modem CDMA means connection to Internet via UMTS in CDMA mobile networks.
Kabinet Authorization means connection to KABINET provider network.
Specify access mode to KABINET provider network.
Enable L2TP server.
Use the following IP as VPN server own IP address in your VPN network.
Enable proxyarp for VPN server.
